title: Board Policy — How It Works

sources.label: OSBA
sources.title: OSBA Policy Services
sources.summary: Overview of OSBA's policy department which provides model policies, legal updates, and policy review services to Oregon school districts.

sources.label: OSBA
sources.title: Board Development Services
sources.summary: OSBA's training and workshop offerings for board members, including policy development, governance, and effective meeting practices.

takeaways: Board policy sets the 'what' and 'why' — administrative regulations set the 'how.'
OSBA provides model policies that districts can adopt and customize to local needs.
The board adopts policy; the superintendent implements it through administrative regulations.
Policies should be reviewed on a regular cycle to ensure legal compliance and relevance.

knowledgeCheck.question: Administrative regulations are adopted by the school board.
knowledgeCheck.explanation: Administrative regulations are developed by the superintendent and staff to implement board policy. The board adopts policy; the superintendent creates the regulations to carry it out.

knowledgeCheck.question: What organization provides model policies for Oregon school districts?
knowledgeCheck.explanation: The Oregon School Boards Association (OSBA) provides model policies that districts can adopt and customize to their local context.
